intro: Astartea astarteoides, commonly known as the slender astartea, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its delicate, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, blooming in early summer. Astartea astarteoides thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
